definition: variant of 得意洋洋[de2 yi4 yang2 yang2]
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: It hasn't stopped the British Navy proceeding on its merry way.
sentences.chinese: 這沒有阻止英國海軍繼續得意揚揚地前進的步伐。

sentences.english: He leaned back , exulting at the success of his plan.
sentences.chinese: 他向後一靠，爲自己計劃的成功而得意揚揚。

sentences.english: Robert was looking at me triumphantly.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯特正得意揚揚地看着我。

sentences.english: When she won the prize, Susan went home looking like the cat that swallowed the canary.
sentences.chinese: 蘇珊獲獎後，回到了家裏，一副得意揚揚的樣子。

sentences.english: He leaned back, exulting at the success of his plan.
sentences.chinese: 他向後一靠，爲自己計劃成功而得意揚揚。

sentences.english: His father's compliment left Jim walking on air.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆受到父親的讚揚而得意揚揚。

sentences.english: Albert was triumphant in his harlequin costume.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾貝得意揚揚地穿着他那件小丑服裝。
